column4: The problem is, after the splash comes up and it goes through those list of items that are followed by "OK", I get left with a screen that just has a solid dash in the upper left hand corner of the screen
now, I know that whatever is supposed to be working is working properly
because when I blindly type in my username and passward then hit enter, I can hear the sound of it logging in
but it still just shows the dash
I can get into the ctrl-alt-f1 virtual terminal to work with things fine
but if I go to terminal 7, the screen just stays with whatever it shows last
so whatever is running by default appears to be running properly, it's just that I don't see any of it
Has anyone heard of a problem like this before?
what's happened there is that X has not started at all.  tty 7 has no process running on it -- that's why when you press alt-f7 your keystroke is ignored and you stay in your current terminal.
What about me being able to type in my username and password blindly and when I hit enter, I hear the entrance sound effect?
from the text only screen, try typing `startx'.  This is what is used to start X.  Watch the messages that will get displayed (on the tty where you type startx)
but I thought you said that when you tried changing to the X tty with alt-F7, you stayed in your current tty?
so, it switches ttys but you end up in what appears to be an empty tty?
do you have any idea what might be causing this?

The error logs should be in /var/log/X??   You could also try startx, after you've kill it with ctl-alt-backspace to see the error messages live on your screen.  As to the cause, I suspect a GNOME config problem -- it's displaying black on black.  I don't know how to fix that thought.
